reviewText: This is another fabulous DVD from the new Gaither Vocal Band.  I love the sound of this group.  The combination with David Phelps, Wes Hampton, Michael English, and Bill Gaither cannot be beat.  David sings a new song he wrote called 'Fools Gold' and I love it!  I keep playing it over and over. But then I have never heard him sing a bad one. His voice is not to be believed.Wes sings a song called 'I will pray for you' and it will really touch your heart. The whole DVD is very entertaining. I also enjoyed the small outtakes when they were all in the van. The humor is great and they seem to really get along well. I do wish they would do more of these.Anyone who gets this DVD along with Pure and Simple #1 will certainly have hours of beautiful entertainment and you will want to play them over and over. :)

reviewText: Has many elements of musical entertainment as well as excellent messages....They sing, they play, they weep with the audience...Wonderful...and the scenes of them in the car really makes it all up close and personal....Compelling performance altogether...

reviewText: This DVD is awesome, the Vocal Band sings and it's like angels singing.  Everyone should buy this DVD and all the Gaither DVD's
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought both DVDs and enjoy them both.One should be aware, however that these are 65 min. DVDs. Other DVDs from this line have been from 90 to 120 minutes.I am editing, because I had the wrong volumes. Volume One is my favorite. However, "Fill My Cup, with Angela (guest performer on this volumetwo) is delightful."Sow Mercy is my least favorite, as I could not help but recall what happens to healthy seed when there are draughts, tornados, flood, fire, or sometimes pests, -like boll weevils, for example. (Yeah, I have picked cotton.)  Sorry Mark. You are one of the best; but that song just isn't my favorite.

reviewText: Any music that the Vocal Band does provides inspiration and the best in Gospel music.  I look forward to more of their works.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am admittedly a GVB junkie. I live in Beijing so perhaps do not have as much exposure to Christian music as I would like. But when these dvd's come to my mail box - it is a good day!I was not disappointed with these two albums. The acoustic instruments, the 'letting loose' of the vocal creativity and the camaraderie in the smattering of road trip anecdotes. I listened to it twice in the first sitting!Well worth the purchase and beyond.
